metadata.description: Configuration with forward-only transfers and logical chunking methods.

hosts.name: Development Environment
hosts.description: Development environment where new features are developed and initially tested.

hosts.name: Testing Environment
hosts.description: Testing environment for thorough validation before production deployment.

hosts.name: Production Environment
hosts.description: Production environment where features are live and available to end-users.

chunking.description: Divide large datasets into smaller chunks for manageable processing and transfer.

methods.description: Chunk data based on logical separations, such as records, categories, or modules.
Fetch and transfer data in pages using pagination parameters.
Process and transfer data in predefined batches based on record count or other criteria.
Segment data based on time intervals, such as daily, weekly, or monthly.
Split data based on hierarchical relationships within the data structure.

compression.description: Compress chunks to reduce transfer size and improve efficiency.

validation.description: Verify each chunk to ensure data integrity before and after transfer.

message_queue.description: Distribute data chunks using a message queue to manage processing order and efficiency.

data_producer.description: Component that publishes data chunks to the message queue.

data_consumer.description: Component that consumes data chunks from the message queue.

pre_transfer_backup.description: Backup the current state of the environment before initiating a transfer to ensure data integrity and recovery if needed.

methods.description: Perform a full backup of the environment's data.
Perform incremental backups for efficiency if required.

verification.description: Verify the backup to ensure it is complete and usable.

allowed_transfers.description: Transfer from Development to Testing for further validation.
Transfer from Testing to Production for live deployment.

disallowed_transfers.description: Direct transfer from Development to Production is not allowed to maintain stability.
Direct transfer from Production to Testing is not allowed to prevent overwriting Testing data.
Direct transfer from Testing to Development is not allowed to maintain data integrity.

process_descriptions.name: Development to Testing
process_descriptions.description: Transfer from Development to Testing. Features are validated in the Testing environment. Post-transfer validation ensures quality before moving to Production.

process_descriptions.name: Testing to Production
process_descriptions.description: Transfer from Testing to Production. Features become live for end-users. Issues detected in Production can be handled as required.

process_descriptions.name: Production to Development
process_descriptions.description: In case features need revision based on Production feedback, they are transferred back to Development. Ensures issues or enhancements are addressed before redeployment.

release_stages.description: Initial stage where new features and fixes are developed and unit tested.
Testing stage for comprehensive validation including functional, integration, and system testing.
Final stage where features are live and available to end-users.
